abstract.text: The inset distances for views.

inlineContent.text: Edge inset values are applied to a rectangle to shrink or expand the area represented by that rectangle. Typically, edge insets are used during view layout to modify the viewâ€™s frame. Positive values cause the frame to be inset (or shrunk) by the specified amount. Negative values cause the frame to be outset (or expanded) by the specified amount.

abstract.text: Adjusts a rectangle by the given edge insets.
